issue.title: help ! my rocket project compile error.

labels.name: no bug
labels.description: The reported bug was confirmed nonexistent

issue.body:

issue.title: Upgrade to hyper 0.12 (WIP)

labels.name: pr: merged
labels.description: This pull request was merged manually.

issue.body:
In order to support websockets, it is necessary to upgrade to the newest hyper version (see [this comment](https://github.com/SergioBenitez/Rocket/issues/90#issuecomment-488267042) in #90). This PR is a simple proof of concept to upgrade to hyper 0.12 which was a bit difficult and I hope, that we can use this PR as a WIP PR to upgrade to hyper 0.12. 

I hope that you can support me to finish the upgrade.

issue.title: Forms that contain structures affected by encoding (such as SocketAddrV4) fail to parse

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Deviation from the specification or expected behavior

issue.body:
## Bug Report

Version 0.4.5
OS: Debian 10 (Linux 4.19.0-10-cloud-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 4.19.132-1 (2020-07-24) x86_64 GNU/Linux)

A Form containing a SocketAddrV4 field is failing to parse input such as 127.0.0.1:80. I'm under the impression that this is because FromFormValue::from_form_value() and subsequently SocketAddrV4::from_str() is being called with the encoded address as a parameter (e.g. 127.0.0.1%3A80) instead of 127.0.0.1:80.

```rust
#[derive(FromForm)]
struct Input {
    ip: SocketAddrV4,
}

#[post("/test", data = "<input>")]
fn test(input: Form<Input>) {}
```

The above code will not parse input such as 127.0.0.1:80 because the colon ':' is encoded. This results in 127.0.0.1%3A80 being passed into FromFormValue::from_form_value() which will fail.

issue.title: current nightly doesn't build example

labels.name: upstream
labels.description: An unresolvable issue: an upstream dependency bug

labels.name: nightly breakage
labels.description: Breakage on the nightly channel only

issue.body:
### Issue

current nightly doesn't build example from https://rocket.rs/v0.4/guide/getting-started/
rustc 1.53.0-nightly (07e0e2ec2 2021-03-24)

tried with: 
rocket = "0.4.7"
rocket = "0.4.6" 

was also posted in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/83710

### Workaround

use `cargo 1.52.0-nightly (572e20153 2021-02-24)`

issue.title: Freeze on 0.5-rc
issue.body:
It's the second time my app freeze, both time the app was running since ~6 weeks

**To Reproduce**

Unable to reproduce easily

**Environment:**

 - Linux optomata 5.16.2-arch1-1 `#1` SMP PREEMPT Thu, 20 Jan 2022 16:18:29 +0000 x86_64 GNU/Linux
 - Docker version 20.10.12, build e91ed5707e

```toml
[profile.release]
opt-level = 2
debug = false
debug-assertions = false
overflow-checks = false
lto = true
panic = 'unwind'
incremental = false
codegen-units = 16
rpath = false

[dependencies.rocket]
version = "0.5.0-rc.1"
features = ["json", "uuid", "tls"]

[dependencies.tokio]
version = "1"
features = ["full"]

[dependencies.deadpool-postgres]
version = "0.9"
default-features = false
features = ["rt_tokio_1"]

[dependencies.tokio-postgres]
version = "0.7"
features = ["runtime", "with-uuid-0_8", "with-chrono-0_4", "with-serde_json-1"]
```

I use TLS, the app is inside a docker. When it's freeze the app is completely unresponsive, not an simple log even in tracing.
 Possibly tokio fault.
